snippet: While the city takes a hard line against the proliferation of guns, it provides for the recycling of bullets.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column supports proposals for exorbitant taxes on hollow-tip bullets, which are designed to penetrate armor and cause devastating damage; scores Mayor Bloomberg's refusal to reconsider city's policy of selling thousands of pounds of spent shell casings to ammunition dealers under the guise of supporting recycling.
lead_paragraph: While the city takes a hard line against the proliferation of guns, it provides for the recycling of bullets.

headline.seo: Taxing Bullets as De Facto Gun Control
headline.main: If Guns Do Not Kill, Tax the Bullets
headline.print_headline: If Guns Do Not Kill, Tax the Bullets
